citation.article-title: Proposals of Sphingomonas paucimobilis gen. nov. and comb. nov., Sphingomonas parapaucimobilis sp. nov., Sphingomonas yanoikuyae sp. nov., Sphingomonas adhaesiva sp. nov., Sphingomonas capsulata comb. nov., and two genospecies of the genus Sphingomonas.

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas yanoikuyae sp. nov.
Sphingomonas yanoikuyae (yano. iku'yae. N.L. adj. in honor of Professor Ikuya Yano, Japenese bacteriologist who first recognized the second major spot of alkaline-stable glycolipid on TLC)
Colonies are smooth, convex, creamy white, and never became definitely yellow after prolonged incubation at room temperature.
In addition to the carbohydrates listed in Table 2, acid was produced oxidatively from glycerol and rhamnose.
Assimilates L-arabinose, D-xylose, galactose, salicin, mannose, D-turanose, and caprate, and not fructose.
Alkaline hydrolysates of total extractable cellular lipids revealed two major spots of alkaline-stable sphingoglucolipid on TLC.
The major long-chain bass of sphingoglycolipid are d-20:1 (44%), d-21:1 (23%), and d-18:0 (18%).
In partial sequence of 16S rRNA, the nucleotides at nine positions were different from those of the type strain of S. paucimobilis.
G+C content of DNA is 61.7 mol%.
